sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
By the Queene. Whereas the Queenes Maiestie our most gracious souerygne Lady, by reason of the plague [and] pestilence as well in the citie of London, as in the citie of Westminster, did lately by her highnes proclamation adiorne part of the tearme of Sainct Michael ... Proclamations. 1577-10-15 England and Wales. Sovereign (1558-1603 : Elizabeth I) Elizabeth I, Queen of England, 1533-1603.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
By Christopher Barkar, printer to the Queenes Maiestie. Cum priuilegio regiæ maiestatis, Imprinted at London : [1577]
Michaelmas Term is adjourned further because of plague. Publication date from STC. Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
=======

By Christopher Barkar, printer to the Queenes Maiestie. Cum priuilegio regiæ maiestatis, Imprinted at London : [1577]
